paper.title: Analyzing Systematic Risk in Global Airline Industry: A Machine Learning Approach
paper.abstract: Beta (beta) is associated with the systematic risk of an asset, which is one of the important concepts used in many areas. Accurate estimation of beta enables investors, portfolio managers, risk analysts, and financial decision-makers to make effective decisions. Accurate beta estimation requires the use of accurate analysis and modeling techniques. In this study, the systematic risk of airline companies traded on the U.S., European, and Turkish stock exchanges between 2015 and 2023 is evaluated, and the impact of different methods on beta estimates is analyzed. Furthermore, the impact of machine learning (ML) algorithms on beta estimation compared with traditional regression methods is examined. It is concluded that Lasso Regression is the algorithm with the lowest error and the highest R2 value among the methods used in the analysis of the data set consisting of airline companies, and the index returns on which beta estimates obtained with ML algorithms are different from traditional regression indicate that the methods and model specifications used in the calculation of beta estimates may change. ML algorithms improve forecasting performance by providing a more flexible and sophisticated modeling approach.

domain_result.justification: 该论文的核心研究内容是使用机器学习算法（如Lasso回归）来更准确地估计beta值，即系统性风险。beta值的准确估计直接关系到金融风险管理中的风险评估和投资组合管理中的资产配置决策。因此，该论文的技术应用主要涉及这两个金融领域。
